skill.name: geo-database
skill.description: Access NCBI GEO for gene expression/genomics data. Search/download microarray and RNA-seq datasets (GSE, GSM, GPL), retrieve SOFT/Matrix files, for transcriptomics and expression analysis.
skill.summary: Access NCBI GEO for gene expression/genomics data. Search/download microarray and RNA-seq datasets (...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation and educational skill. Contains only markdown documentation with Python code examples for accessing public NCBI GEO database APIs. No executable code, no network operations, no file system access beyond standard data downloads to user-specified directories.

content.user_title: Access gene expression data from NCBI GEO
content.value_statement: Researchers need to find and download gene expression datasets for transcriptomics studies but navigating NCBI GEO manually is time-consuming. This skill provides Python code examples for searching GEO DataSets, retrieving expression matrices, and performing differential expression analysis with GEOparse and Biopython.
actual_capabilities: Search GEO DataSets by keyword, organism, or experimental condition
Download GEO Series (GSE), Samples (GSM), and Platforms (GPL) using GEOparse
Retrieve gene-specific expression profiles across studies
Access NCBI E-utilities for programmatic metadata queries
Perform differential expression analysis with statistical tests
Batch download multiple datasets and perform meta-analyses
limitations: Does not provide pre-processed analysis results or visualizations
Requires user to install GEOparse and Biopython dependencies
NCBI API rate limits apply without an API key (3 requests per second)
User must provide their email address for NCBI E-utilities compliance

use_cases.title: Download expression data
use_cases.description: Find and download gene expression datasets for specific diseases or conditions for downstream analysis.

use_cases.title: Batch process GEO series
use_cases.description: Retrieve and process multiple GEO series for meta-analysis across independent studies.

use_cases.title: Perform expression analysis
use_cases.description: Extract expression matrices and calculate differential gene expression with statistical tests.

prompt_templates.title: Find datasets
prompt_templates.prompt: Find GEO datasets studying [condition] in [organism] published in the last 2 years.

prompt_templates.title: Download series
prompt_templates.prompt: Download GEO series [accession] and extract the expression matrix for all samples.

prompt_templates.title: Gene expression
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me all GEO profiles for gene [gene_name] across human studies.

prompt_templates.title: Batch analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Download and perform differential expression analysis comparing [condition_a] vs [condition_b] across datasets [list].

output_examples.input: Find GEO datasets for breast cancer gene expression in human samples from 2023
output: â€¢ GSE258922: Breast tumor vs normal adjacent tissue (48 samples)
â€¢ GSE255107: Triple-negative breast cancer molecular profiling (156 samples)
â€¢ GSE251506: Hormone receptor status and expression profiles (89 samples)

best_practices: Set Entrez.email and obtain an API key from NCBI for higher rate limits
Cache downloaded files locally to avoid repeated API calls
Always cite original GEO studies when using their data in publications
Check platform annotations and data processing methods before analysis
anti_patterns: Assuming all expression values are in the same scale or transformation
Ignoring batch effects when combining data from multiple studies
Skipping sample metadata quality checks before analysis
Using probe IDs without mapping to gene symbols for biological interpretation

faq.question: Which Python libraries do I need?
faq.answer: Install GEOparse for data access, Biopython for E-utilities, and pandas/scipy for analysis.

faq.question: What are the NCBI rate limits?
faq.answer: 3 requests per second without an API key, 10 requests per second with a key from NCBI.

faq.question: How do I cite GEO data?
faq.answer: Cite both the original study and the GEO database publication: Barrett et al. Nucleic Acids Research.

faq.question: What file formats does GEO use?
faq.answer: SOFT (primary format), Series Matrix (expression values), and MINiML (XML-based).

faq.question: How large can GEO files get?
faq.answer: Large series can exceed 1GB for matrix files; supplementary files like raw data are often much larger.

faq.question: What is GEO2R?
faq.answer: A web-based tool for quick differential expression analysis without coding, generates reproducible R scripts.
